bientity_condition.description: If specified, this condition type will only evaluate to true if this condition is fulfilled by either or both the '*_actor_*' and '*_target_*' entities.
bientity_condition.markdownDescription: If specified, this condition type will only evaluate to true if this condition is fulfilled by either or both the '*_actor_*' and '*_target_*' entities.

type.description:
## Riding Root --- [Entity Condition Type](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/entity_condition_types/riding_root) Checks whether the '__actor__' entity is indirectly riding the '__target__' entity. Type ID: `origins:riding_root` --- ### üìù Note In the context for this entity condition type, the '__actor__' entity is the passenger and the entity that invoked the condition while the '__target__' is the entity that is being indirectly ridden (at the start of the riding chain). --- ### Examples ```json "condition": { "type": "origins:riding_root" } ``` This example will check if the '__actor__' entity is riding an entity.
```json "condition": { "type": "origins:riding_root", "bientity_condition": { "type": "origins:target_condition", "condition": { "type": "origins:entity_type", "entity_type": "minecraft:pig" } } } ``` This example will check if the '__actor__' entity is riding a pig. This will also check if the '__actor__' entity is riding the passenger(s) of a pig.

Type ID: `origins:riding_root` --- ### üìù Note In the context for this entity condition type, the '__actor__' entity is the passenger and the entity that invoked the condition while the '__target__' is the entity that is being indirectly ridden (at the start of the riding chain). --- ### Examples ```json "condition": { "type": "origins:riding_root" } ``` This example will check if the '__actor__' entity is riding an entity.
```json "condition": { "type": "origins:riding_root", "bientity_condition": { "type": "origins:target_condition", "condition": { "type": "origins:entity_type", "entity_type": "minecraft:pig" } } } ``` This example will check if the '__actor__' entity is riding a pig. This will also check if the '__actor__' entity is riding the passenger(s) of a pig.

x-intellij-html-description:
title: Riding Root (Entity Condition Type) date: 2021-10-07

Riding Root

Entity Condition Type

Checks whether the 'actor' entity is indirectly riding the 'target' entity.

Type ID: origins:riding_root

!!! note

In the context for this entity condition type, the '**actor**' entity is the passenger and the entity that invoked the condition while the '**target**' is the entity that is being indirectly ridden (at the start of the riding chain).

Fields

Field Type Default Description
bientity_condition Bi-entity Condition Type optional If specified, this condition type will only evaluate to true if this condition is fulfilled by either or both the 'actor' and 'target' entities.

Examples

"condition": {
    "type": "origins:riding_root"
}

This example will check if the 'actor' entity is riding an entity. 

"condition": {
    "type": "origins:riding_root",
    "bientity_condition": {
        "type": "origins:target_condition",
        "condition": {
            "type": "origins:entity_type",
            "entity_type": "minecraft:pig"
        }
    }
}

This example will check if the 'actor' entity is riding a pig. This will also check if the 'actor' entity is riding the passenger(s) of a pig.
